intro: Unona hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy unona, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and broad, heart-shaped leaves. It produces showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color.
